column1: Janet's ducks lay 16 eggs a day. She eats 3 for breakfast every morning and uses 4 to make muffins for her friends every day. She takes the remaining duck eggs to the farmer’s market every day and sells them for $2 per fresh egg. How much money does she make every day at the farmers market?
Crafting a robe requires 2 bolts of blue fiber cloth and half that amount of white fiber cloth. How many pieces of fabric will it use in total?
Josh decided to give home renovation a try. He bought a house for $80,000 and put $50,000 into repairs. Doing so increased the value of the house by 150%. How much profit did he make?
James decided to run 3 sprints three times a week, each sprint covering 60 meters. How many meters does he run in total every week?

Wendy feeds each of her chickens 3 cups of a mixed chicken feed containing seeds, mealworms, and vegetables every day to help them stay healthy. She feeds the chickens 3 meals. In the morning, she feeds the chickens 15 cups of feed. In the afternoon, she feeds the chickens 25 cups of feed. If Wendy's flock size reaches 20 birds, how many cups of feed will she need to feed her chickens at the last meal of the day?
Kylar goes to the store to buy glasses for her new apartment. A glass is $5, but the second glass is only 60% of the original price. Kylar wants to buy 16 glasses. How much does he need to pay?
Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston. Charleston has 4 times as many sheep as Seattle. If there are 20 sheep in Seattle, how many sheep are there in Toulouse, Charleston, and Seattle?

Kara is downloading a 200 GB file. Normally, she was downloading 2 GB per minute, but at 40% of the download, Windows forced a reboot to install the update, a process that took 20 minutes. Kara then had to re-download it from the beginning. How long does it take to download this file?

John drove at 60 miles per hour for 3 hours and then turned around because he realized he had left something very important at home. He tried to get home in 4 hours, but the first 2 hours were spent in traffic. He drove at 30 miles per hour for the next half hour and then 80 miles per hour for the remainder of the four hours. At the end of the 4 hours, how far away is he from home?

Eliza is paid $10 an hour for the first 40 hours she works per week. She also earns 1.2 times her standard hourly rate for overtime work. If Eliza worked 45 hours this week, how much did she earn this week?

A new program was downloaded 60 times in the first month, tripled the number of downloads in the second month, but had 30% fewer downloads in the third month. In the past three months, how many times has this program been downloaded?
Tula went to the bakery and bought various pastries. She bought 3 dozen donuts ($68 each), 2 dozen mini cupcakes ($80 each) and 6 dozen mini cheesecakes ($55 each). How much did it cost in total?

Carlos is planting a lemon tree. The tree costs $90 to plant. The tree produces 7 lemons each year, which sell for $1.50 each. It costs $3 per year to water and fertilize the tree. How many years will it take him to start making money from this lemon tree?

Melanie is a door-to-door saleswoman. She sold a third of the vacuum cleaners in the green house, 2 more in the red house, and half of the remaining vacuum cleaners in the orange house. If Melanie has 5 vacuum cleaners left, how many vacuum cleaners did she start with?

There are 20 students in the dance class, 20% of whom are enrolled in modern dance, 25% of the remaining students are enrolled in jazz dance, and the rest are enrolled in hip-hop dance. What percentage of students have signed up to learn hip-hop dance?

A businessman wants to choose between two purchase plans: $5,000 worth of jewelry and $8,000 worth of electronics. His financial advisor speculates that the jewelry market will rise 2.5%, while the electronics market will also rise 1.2% during the same month. If the businessman expects to make the maximum profit at the end of the month by making a choice, what will the profit be?

Both trains left San Rafael at the same time. They started heading west and both traveled 80 miles. The next day they headed north, covering 150 miles. How far did each train travel during these two days?

Jill makes $20 an hour as a teacher and $30 an hour as a cheerleading coach. If she works 50 weeks per year, 35 hours per week as a teacher and 15 hours per week as a coach, what is her annual salary?
Claire makes an omelette with 3 eggs for breakfast every morning. How many dozen eggs can she eat in four weeks?

Marissa was hiking on a 12-mile trail. It took her an hour to cover the first 4 miles, and then another hour to cover the 2 miles. If she wants an average speed of 4 miles per hour, what speed (in miles per hour) does she need to reach to cover the remaining distance?

I had 10 liters of orange juice drink, two thirds of which was water, and I wanted to add it to 15 liters of pineapple juice drink (three fifths of which was water), but when I was pouring the drink, I spilled a liter Orange juice drink. How much water is contained in the remaining 24 liters of drink?
Raymond and Samantha are cousins. Raymond is 6 years older than Samantha. Raymond has a 23-year-old son. If Samantha is 31 years old now, how many years ago was Raymond's son born?

Billy sells DVDs. He had eight customers on Tuesday. The first 3 customers each bought a DVD. The next 2 customers each bought 2 DVDs. The last 3 customers did not purchase any DVDs. How many DVDs did Billy sell on Tuesday?
A candle melts 2 cm for every hour it burns. How many centimeters does a candle get shorter when it burns from 1:00 PM to 5:00 PM?
Kyle paid $19.50 for a copy of last year's bestseller, 25% off the original price. What was the original price of this book?

Mary ordered a $12 chicken meal, 5 cartons of milk ($3 each), 4 apples ($1.50 each), and several boxes of pizza. Marie paid a total of $50. If each box of pizza costs $8.50, how many boxes does Marie order?
Mishka bought 3 pairs of shorts, 3 pairs of trousers and 3 pairs of shoes. Shorts are $16.50 each, pants are $22.50 each and shoes are $42 each. How much did Mishka spend on all these costumes?
Cynthia eats an ice cream every night. She bought several boxes of ice cream, each containing 15 servings, for $4.00 each. How much did she spend on ice cream after 60 days?

On a 60-mile bike trip, Henry stopped twice. He stopped the first time after 20 miles of the ride and the second time 15 miles before the end of the journey. How many miles did he ride between his first stop and his second stop?

Gloria was shoe shopping when she came across a pair of boots that fit her shoe budget. However, she had to choose between the boots and two pairs of heels that cost only $5 less than the boots. If one pair of heels costs $33 and another pair of heels costs twice that much, what is the price of the boots?
The age ratio between Darrell and Aaron is 7:11. If their combined ages now are 162, calculate Allen's age 10 years from now.

Gant tries to count the number of jelly beans in the jar. He asked his friends how many jelly beans they thought were in the jar. The first person said there were 80. The second person says 20 more grains than half the first person said. The third person said 25% more than the first person said. What is the average of the quantities they guessed?
John takes care of 10 dogs. The time required for daily errands and walking per dog is 0.5 hours. How much time does he spend each week taking care of the dogs?
Gretchen has 110 coins. There are 30 more gold coins than silver coins. How many gold coins does Gretchen have?

Siobhan's jewelry count is 2 less than Alan's jewelry count. Allen's jewelry count is 5 more than half of Raymond's jewelry count. If Raymond has 40 pieces of jewelry, how many pieces of jewelry does Siobhan have?
Mike played table tennis for 40 minutes. He scored four points in the first 20 minutes. In the second 20 minutes, his scoring increased by 25 percent. What is his total score?
Terry eats 2 servings of yogurt a day. Yogurt is on sale right now, 4 servings for just $5.00. How much did he spend on yogurt in 30 days?

John plans to sell all his toys and use the money to buy video games. He has 13 Lego sets and sells them for $15 each. He ended up buying 8 video games for $20 each, and he still had $5 left. How many Lego sets does he have left?
John runs 60 miles a week. He runs three days a week, three hours on the first day, and half the time on the first two days. What is his running speed?

Dana runs four times as fast as she walks, but she jumps half as fast as she can run. If she can jump 3 miles per hour, how much distance does she cover in 6 hours, running one-third of the time and walking two-thirds of the time?
Brandon’s iPhone is three times older than Ben’s iPhone. Ben's iPhone is twice as old as Susie's iPhone. If Susie's iPhone is 1 year old, how old is Brandon's iPhone?

The dragon Pelg perched atop Mount Farbo, breathing fire at everything within a 1,000-foot radius. Polly can throw the Golden Gun, the only known dragon-slaying weapon, up to 400 feet away, a distance that's just within range of the dragon's fire breath. But when Polly held the sapphire, she threw the golden gun three times farther than when she threw the gun without the sapphire. If Polly is holding the gem and wants to hit the dragon with a golden spear, how far can she stand outside the range of the dragon's fire breath?

Grandma Jones baked five slices of apple pie for the fireman's lunch. She cut each pie into eight slices and placed the five pies outside on the buffet table for guests to help themselves. At the end of lunch, after guests had finished their portions of pie, 14 slices of pie were left. How many pies did the guests take away?

According to the Nutrition Facts, a bag of potato chips contains 250 calories per serving. If a 300g bag of crisps contains 5 servings and your daily calorie target is 2,000 and you've already eaten 1,800 calories, how many more grams of crisps can you eat?

Charlie wants to sell beeswax candles. He can make 10 taper candles per pound of beeswax. The supply cost for one pound of beeswax and required candle wicks is $10.00. If he sells each candle for $2.00 and he makes and sells 20 candles, what is his net profit?

Meredith is a freelance blogger who writes daily blog posts about health topics and submits them to clients as part of her regular career. A blog post takes an average of 4 hours to research and write. Last week, she wrote 5 blog posts on Monday. She writes 2/5 times more blog posts on Tuesday than she did on Monday. She wrote twice as many blog posts on Wednesday as she did on Tuesday. Calculate the total time she spent writing blog posts during these three days.

Candace puts 80 Post-it notes in her wallet before going to work at the coffee shop. On her way to work, she stopped at a store and bought a pack of Post-it notes; at work, she put a Post-it note on each of her 220 different coffee mugs. If she has a total of 23 sticky notes left, how many sticky notes are in the pack of sticky notes she bought?
John bought twice as many red ties as blue ties. The price of a red tie is 50% higher than the price of a blue tie. He spent $200 on blue ties that cost $40 each. How much did he spend on the tie?
Trish uses a 4-foot piece of wire to support her tomatoes in the vegetable garden. The wire is cut into small sections, each 6 inches long. How many paragraphs did she get?
Richard lives in a 15-story apartment building. There are 8 units per floor and 3/4 of the building is occupied. What is the total number of unoccupied units in this building?
Lloyd has an egg laying farm. His chickens lay 252 eggs a day, and he sells them for $2 a dozen. How much money does Lloyd make each week from eggs?
Tom's boat travels 10 miles per hour. He sailed from 1pm to 4pm. He then returned at a speed of 6 miles per hour. How long will it take for him to return?

Uriah's bag was too heavy for him. He needs to lose 15 pounds from his backpack. His comic books weigh 1/4 pound each and his toys weigh 1/2 pound each. If he takes away 30 comic books, how many more toys does he need to take away?

Mechanics charge different prices to repair tires on trucks and cars. A mechanic charges $60 to repair a truck tire and $40 to repair a car tire. On Thursday, mechanics serviced six truck tires and four car tires. On Friday, mechanics serviced 12 car tires but not any truck tires. How much more did the machinist make on the higher-earning day?

As the Doubtfire sisters were driving home with seven adopted kittens from a local animal shelter, their mother called to tell them that two of their family cats had just given birth to kittens. She said Patch (the first cat) gave birth to twice as many kittens as adopted kittens, while Traxie (the second cat) gave birth to 12. How many kittens does the Doubtfire family have now?
Gene has 30 lollipops. Gene ate 2 of the lollipops. For the remaining lollipops, Gene wanted a pack of 2. How many bags can Gene carry?
Peter plans to go to the movies this week. He always paid $7 for a ticket and $7 for a popcorn. If he had $42 this week, how many times could he go to the movies?

The maximum weight a wooden bridge can hold is 5,000 pounds. A freight truck filled with identical boxes (each weighing 15 pounds) will cross the bridge. The total of the driver's weight and the empty weight of the truck is 3,755 pounds. How many boxes can this truck carry without exceeding the bridge's weight limit?

Stephen places an order for daily necessities online. His final bill was $40.00. Because the order went through a delivery provider, they added a 25% fee to his final bill total and charged him a $3.00 delivery fee. Stephen also added a $4.00 tip. After adding these additional costs, what is the final price for Stephen's groceries?
One raspberry bush produced six clusters of 20 raspberries each, and there were an additional 67 raspberries scattered throughout the bush. How many raspberries are there in total?
There are 25 oranges in a basket, 1 is bad, 20% are underripe, 2 are sour and the rest are good. How many good oranges are there?

Janet bought a brooch for her daughter. She paid $500 for materials for the brooch and another $800 to make it to the jeweler. She then paid 10% of the total to insure the brooch. How much did she pay in total?

If Marcy had worked for the same company for 40 years, she would have received an annual pension of $50,000 per year. She is entitled to 5% of the pension value each year starting after 20 years. If she resigns after 30 years, what will be her annual pension at that time?

Yarina subscribes to the streaming service, which costs $140 per year. If the streaming company charges her an initial amount for the first half of the year and then charges her 10% less for the second half of the year, calculate the total amount she pays for the streaming service at the end of the year.

Sofia is considering a road trip and wants to know how far she can travel on a tank of gasoline. She has driven 100 miles since her last refueling, and she needs 4 gallons of gas to fill the tank again. Her car's gas tank holds 12 gallons of gasoline, according to her car's owner's manual. How far can Sofia travel on a tank of gasoline?
Jim watched television for 2 hours and then decided to read a book in bed for 1 hour. He does this three times a week. How much time did he spend watching TV and reading in 4 weeks?

There are four schools vying for the basketball championship crown. Each school fielded a girls' basketball team and a boys' basketball team with five players on each team. Each school also has a coach for each of its teams. How many people did these schools send in total?

A treasure hunter finds a buried treasure chest. The treasure chest is filled with gems, including 175 diamonds, 35 less rubies than diamonds, and twice as many emeralds as rubies. How many gems are in the treasure chest?
In Dr. Weitz's school, there were twice as many boys as girls. If there are 60 girls and there is one teacher for every 5 students, how many teachers are there in this school?
Bailey initially received a certain amount of money. She then received $5 per week for 8 weeks. If Bailey has received a total of $100 at the end of the 8 weeks, how much did she receive initially?
Judy teaches 5 dance classes every day and weekends, and 8 dance classes on Saturdays. If she has 15 students per class and she charges $15.00 per student, how much money will she make per week?
Kellyanne has two cookbooks, the first with 20 instructions and the second with twice as many instructions as the first. How many instructions does Kellyanne have to read in order to cook two dishes?
Tommy is raising money for his charity by selling brownies ($3 each) and cheesecakes ($4 each). If Tommy sold 43 brownies and 23 cheesecakes, how much money did he raise?
Sheila bought 5 cell phones for $150 each. She paid in 3 monthly installments with an interest rate of 2% per installment. How much will Sheela have to pay each month during these three months?

Arti has a flower stall at the farmers market. He sells three types of flowers: marigolds, petunias and begonias. He usually sells a pot of marigolds for $2.74, a pot of petunias for $1.87 and a pot of begonias for $2.12. Artie didn't have any change today, so he decided to round up all the prices. How much money would Arti make if he sold 12 pots of marigolds, 9 pots of petunias, and 17 pots of begonias?

Luke is building a sandcastle on the beach. He finally noticed that each level of the sandcastle was half the area of ​​the next level. If he builds a 4-story sandcastle where the top floor has an area of ​​16, what is the average area of ​​the first floor?

Cecilia just bought a puppy. As per the veterinarian's orders, she must feed the puppy 1 cup of dog food per day for the first 180 days. She must then feed the puppy 2 cups of dog food per day for the rest of the puppy's life. If 1 bag of dog food contains 110 cups of dog food, how many bags of dog food will Cecilia use in the first year?

Assume that Raymond's laundry load is half that of Sarah's, and Sarah's laundry load is 4 times that of David's. If Sarah's laundry load is 400 pounds, calculate the difference between Raymond's and David's laundry loads. .
Vincent can buy a bouquet of 3 for $2.50 or a bouquet of 2 for $1. How much money would he save if he bought 18 flowers at a better price?
John adopted a dog. He took the dog for a grooming session, which cost $100. Because he was a new customer, the pet groomer gave him a 30% discount. How much did this beauty treatment cost?
Both girls get 1/6 of 24 liters of water each. Then one boy was given 6 liters of water. How many liters of water are left?

Charlie has 10 stickers. He bought 21 stickers from a store in the mall and received 23 stickers for his birthday. Charlie then gave 9 of the stickers to his sister and decorated the card with 28 stickers. How many stickers does Charlie have left?
Grace weighs 125 pounds. Alex weighs 2 pounds less than Grace, who weighs four times. What is their total weight in pounds?
Dan planted 3 rose bushes. There are 25 roses per rose bush. Each rose has 8 thorns. How many thorns are there in total?
A football team plays 22 games. They won eight more games than they lost. How many games have they won?

Gene is sewing a quilt out of old souvenir T-shirts. He has a T-shirt for every vacation he takes. Each T-shirt is a piece of the quilt. Each row is sewn from a patchwork of different holidays from each year. He takes four vacations a year and has been doing so since he was 23 years old. He is now 34 years old. How many quilt patches does he have in total?

Greg sets his alarm to go off three times a day as a reminder. When the alarm goes off, it goes off until Greg turns it off. Today it rang four times for the first time. It rings three times as often as it did the first time. The third time it rings half as many times as the second time. How many times did the alarm ring in total?

One company paid each employee $600 per month. The company has a policy of increasing the salary of each such employee by 10% of the initial salary every year for those employees who have been with the company for 5 years. If Sylvie completed exactly five years with this company last December, what will her annual salary be after she has worked for three more years?
Marilyn's first record sold 10 times as many copies as Harold's. If they sold a total of 88,000 records, how many records did Harold sell?

Christina is planning a birthday party and the number of gift bags needed is 0.75 per invited guest because 1/4 of the guests did not show up. She invited 16 friends. Gift bags are $2 each. How much will it cost her?

Ted the T-Rex plans to bring potato salad to a dinosaur picnic. He knew that each adult dinosaur would eat 10 pounds of potato salad, and each juvenile would eat half that amount. If there are 20 adult dinosaurs and 5 juvenile dinosaurs at the picnic, and Ted wants to have enough salad for each dinosaur, how many pounds of potato salad will he need to bring?
Jen has three times as many pets as Marcia, and Marcia has two more pets than Cindy. If Cindy has four pets, how many pets do the three of them have in total?
Emily has 4 children named Amy, Jackson, Corey and James. Amy is 5 years older than Jackson and 2 years younger than Corey. If James is 10 years old and 1 year younger than Corey, how old is Jackson?

Lee used to be able to run the 400m hurdles 2 seconds faster than Gerald could run the 400m hurdles, but Gerald changed his diet and was able to improve his speed by 10%. If Lee completed the 400-meter hurdles in 38 seconds, how many seconds would it take Gerald to complete the 400-meter hurdles after improving his eating habits?

In one neighborhood, the number of pet rabbits is 12 fewer than the number of pet dogs and cats combined. If the ratio of cats to dogs is 2 to 1 and the number of dogs is 60, how many pets are there in this community?
Of the 200 fifth graders, 2/5 are boys and 2/3 of the girls are Girl Scouts. How many girls are not Girl Scouts?
Harry slept for nine hours last night. His friend James only gets 2/3 of the sleep time that Harry does. How many more hours of sleep did Harry get than James?

When Freda cooked the canned tomatoes into tomato sauce, the serving size was reduced by half. Each 16-ounce can of tomatoes she used contained 3 tomatoes. Freda's last batch of ketchup was a 32 oz. How many tomatoes did Freda use?

Cars lined up on the highway. Some cars drove through the first 15 minutes of the jam, and then another 20 drove through the remaining 15 minutes of the jam. Five of the cars in the queue took the highway exit, so they didn't have to drive through the traffic jam. If there are 30 cars on the highway at the earliest, how many cars drive through the traffic jam in the first 15 minutes?

Mary was a passionate gardener. Yesterday, she received 18 potted plants from her favorite nursery. There are already 2 potted plants in each of the 40 windowsills in her large country home. In a feeling of generosity, she decided to take 1 potted plant from each window sill to give to friends and family tomorrow. How many potted plants does Mary have left?

Jerome had 4 friends who came to visit him one day. The first friend rang the doorbell 20 times before Jerome answered the door, and the second friend rang the doorbell 1/4 more times than Jerome's first friend. The third friend rang the doorbell 10 more times than the fourth friend. If the fourth friend rings the doorbell 60 times, how many times does the doorbell ring?

Solo had to read 4 pages of science, 20 pages of social studies, 7 pages of history and 8 pages of geography. Solo read 15 pages on Monday. If he has 4 days to complete all his reading assignments, how many pages does he need to read in an average day?

John likes to drink a glass of water with breakfast, lunch and dinner. Finally, he also drinks a glass of water before going to bed. John does this every weekday, but on the weekends, he likes to relax and drink soda with dinner. How many glasses of water does John drink in a week?

A fog bank spreads from the ocean to cover the city. It takes 10 minutes to cover every 3 miles of the city. If the distance of the city from the coastal strip to the opposite inland edge is 42 miles, how many minutes will it take for the fog bank to cover the entire city?

Poppy is putting together a 1,000-piece puzzle. She finished a quarter of the pieces on the puzzle board, and then her mother finished a third of the remaining pieces. How many pieces of the puzzle are left to put together?
Cody ate three times as many cookies as Amir. If Amir ate 5 cookies, how many cookies did they eat in total?
John has 3 boxes. Each box is 5 inches by 6 inches by 4 inches. Box surrounds are 1 inch thick. What is the total internal volume of all 3 boxes?

Frankie watches TV every night after finishing his homework. On Mondays and Tuesdays, he watches a one-hour episode of his favorite show every night. On Wednesday, he watched several 30-minute episodes of the show. On Thursday, he finished his homework early and watched a one-hour episode and a 30-minute episode. On Friday, since it was the weekend and he could stay up late, he watched 2 1 hour episodes. If he watched a total of 7 hours of television, how many 30-minute episodes did he watch on Wednesday?

Henry is making cookies for a local baking competition. He wants to do double what he did last year. When he finished baking, he realized that he had actually made 15 more cookies than he wanted to. While taking the cookies out to cool, he dropped 5 cookies and now has a total of 110 cookies. How many cookies did Henry make last year?

A local gas station sells gasoline for $3.00 per gallon. An app company is offering $0.20 per gallon cash back if you fill up at this station. If someone purchases 10 gallons of gas, how much does that person spend on gas after receiving the cash back reward?

Marshal and Beatrix were having a competition to see who could eat the most fruit roll-ups, so they rolled out as many as they found. Unfortunately, someone made a mistake, Beatrix's fruit roll-up is 2 fruit rolls wide and 24 fruit rolls long, while Marshal's fruit roll-up is 3 fruit rolls wide and 14 fruit rolls long. . If both of them eat them all, how many pieces do they eat on average?

While Juliet is on the lake, her boat leaks. For every 10 feet she rowed toward shore, the boat took on 2 liters of water. She rowed 20 feet in 16 seconds. It takes 64 seconds to reach shore. How much water did the boat take in when Juliet reached the shore?

One classroom has a whiteboard shared by 4 teachers who take turns using the classroom. Each teacher has 2 classes per day and uses a whiteboard in each class. If the whiteboard is wiped three times per class, how many times per day is the whiteboard wiped?
Lane plants 2 flowers in his garden every day. If 5 trees do not grow, how many flowers will he have after 15 days?

Jamal's phone holds six times as many photos as Brittany's phone. The maximum number of photos Brittany's phone can hold is 50 times the number of ducks in Jamal's photo of ducks at the zoo. If Jamal's phone could hold 1,800 photos, how many ducks could Jamal see in the photo he took at the zoo?

Sasha noticed that after she bought some lumber, the price of lumber increased by 50% in the past few months. Since she had wood left over, she decided to sell it. She was left with 10 2 x 4 x 10 boards, each of which cost her $10. She also has five 4 x 4 x 10 boards, which cost her $16 each. How much profit will she make if she sells them all?
Katie makes coffee with a ratio of 7 teaspoons of sugar to 13 cups of water. If she used a total of 120 teaspoons and cups of sugar and water, calculate how many teaspoons of sugar she used.
John bought 2 pairs of shoes for each of his 3 children at a cost of $60 each. How much did he pay?

A customs officer at the main dock at Seaside Clearance counted 2 imported bicycle containers, each containing 5 bicycles. The next day more containers arrived, bringing the total number of bikes on the dock to 30. Calculate the number of containers imported for the next day, assuming that all containers contain 5 bicycles each.

Adrian's total salary is 30% higher than Leila's total salary. Four years later, his salary had increased and he was earning 40 percent more than he had four years earlier. If Adrian's salary and Leila's salary increase at the same time, Adrian's income four years ago was $40,000. Calculate the total salary of both people four years later?
Miguel draws on 2 stacks of paper each week. If the stack of paper contains 30 sheets, how many sheets of paper does he use each month?

Morissette and Kyle were asked to bring fruit. Morissette brought 5 apples and 8 oranges, while Kel brought twice as many apples and half as many oranges as Morissette. How much fruit did they bring in total?

Sadie slept 8 hours on Monday. She lost 2 hours of sleep each of the next two days because she had to complete some tasks. If she slept 1 hour more the rest of the week than she did on those two days, how many hours did she sleep on Monday?
Rosie can run for 3 hours at 10 miles per hour. After that, she ran 5 miles an hour. How many miles can she run in 7 hours?

Jenny helps in her mother's office. She has a stack of 60 letters that need stamps and a stack of letters that have already been stamped. She stamps the third of the letter that requires stamps. If there are 30 letters in the pile of stamped letters now, how many letters will be in the pile when Jenny starts stamping them?

Juliet is preparing for a dinner party at her home, where she plans to serve stew. She noticed she was out of plastic spoons, so she bought a pack of new spoons. Later, her husband also bought a pack of 5 new spoons and brought them to Juliet. When Juliet was making the stew, she used 3 spoons to taste the stew. Later, when she was laying out the dishes, there were 12 spoons. How many spoons were in the pack of spoons that Juliet bought?

Dylan needs chicken and fish sausages to make sausage bread for the party. He bought 38 chicken sausages and bought 6 more fish sausages than chicken sausages. How many sausages did Dylan buy in total?
After transferring to the new school, Amy made 20 more friends than Lily. If Lily made 50 friends, how many friends did Lily and Amy make in total?

Will's mother sells watermelons, peppers and oranges at the local store. The price of watermelon is three times the price of pepper. The price of an orange is $5 less than the price of a watermelon. Dillon was sent to the store to purchase 4 watermelons, 20 peppers, and 10 oranges. If each pepper costs $15, how much does it cost him in total?

A hospital sees 500 people a day. The average patient visit lasted 24 minutes. The doctor charges the hospital $150 an hour, and the hospital charges the patient $200 an hour. How much profit does the hospital make from these visits?

Nissa hired 60 seasonal workers to play elves in her department store's Christmas village. A third of the elves quit after kids threw up on them, and then 10 of the remaining elves quit after kids kicked them in the shin. How many elves are left?
Joseph's expenses in May were $500. In June, he spent $60 less. What was his total expenditure during these two months?

Pam and Fred go to the carnival. Pam rode the roller coaster 2 times and Fred rode the roller coaster 4 times. After this, they each decided to take 2 sleigh rides. If each ride requires 6 tickets, how many tickets did they use that day?
On Monday, Walter walked 4 miles. On Tuesday, he walked 6 times as far as he walked on Monday. His total mileage from Monday to Wednesday was 41 miles. How many miles did he walk on Wednesday?
Tom washes the car four times a week. If each car wash costs $15, how much will he pay per year?
Brian's friend Poppy has 5 fewer video games than Brian has 3 times as many. If Brian had 20 video games, but lost 5 just before the comparison, how many did Poppy have?

There are 27 unicorns left in the world, a third of which are in the Scottish Highlands. Two-thirds of the unicorns in the Scottish Highlands are female. How many female unicorns are there in Scotland?

Rory ordered takeout of 2 Submarine Burgers ($7.50 each), 2 packages of chips ($1.50 each), and 2 cookies ($1.00 each). There was an additional 20% delivery fee at checkout, and she wanted to add a $5.00 tip. How much does her takeaway cost?

Mark took a 75-question test yesterday. He completed the test at a rate of five questions per hour. Today, he took another 100-question test at the same pace. If Mark has 8 hours to complete the first quiz and 6 hours to complete the second quiz, how many questions does he have left unanswered?
In a candy machine, there are 22 more pink gumballs than four times the number of blue gumballs. If there are 12 blue gum balls, how many pink gum balls are there?
Of the 20 cars available for rent, 12 are automatic, 4 are manual and the remainder are semi-automatic. What percentage of cars are semi-automatic?
There are 700 bees in the hive. There are twice as many worker bees as there are brood bees, and there are twice as many brood bees as there are queen bees. How many worker bees are there?
Jordan plays video games 2 hours a day. He also has a part-time job that pays $10 an hour. How much money would Jordan make in a week if he used his gaming time to work?
John spends $2 on milk, $3 on eggs, $3 on a light bulb, $3 on a cup, and $4 on a cockroach trap. If all non-food items were subject to a 10% tax, how much would all items cost?

Kim has started her own housekeeping company and is calculating how much profit she can make from her customers. He already has three clients but is in talks with five prospects and is confident enough to include them in the calculations. Cleaning each client's house will require 2 bottles of bleach and a pack of rags. Bleach is $2 per bottle and $5 per pack of wipes. These are his only expenses. It was calculated that his total weekly earnings would be $92. Profit is the difference between total revenue and total expenses, so how many dollars in profit will Lucas make each week?
John has 10 hectares of pineapple land. There are 100 pineapples per hectare. John harvests pineapples every 3 months. How many pineapples can John harvest in one year?

Johnny is picking up toys from the floor in his room. He poured a 500-piece boxed set of Lego onto the floor, along with a set that contained three times as much Lego as the 500-piece set, and a set that contained only a quarter of that amount. If Johnny were to pick up all the Lego, how many pieces would he pick up?

Deborah is monitoring a hive to see how many bees come in and out throughout the day. She saw 30 bees leaving the hive in the first 6 hours, then she saw 1/2 that number returning in the next 6 hours. Over the next six hours she saw twice as many bees as she had first seen fly out of the hive and leave. Then every bee that left before that and has not yet returned returns to the hive over the next 6 hours. How many bees does Deborah see returning to the hive during the last 6 hours of the day?

Brittany and her mom go to the museum. Admission is $12 for adults and $10 for children. Brittany's mom gave the cashier money for 1 child ticket and 1 adult ticket. If she receives $8 in change, how many dollars does she give to the cashier?
Charlie has three times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy. James has 4 times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy. If Charlie has 12 Facebook friends, how many Facebook friends does James have?

Steve and Tim decided to see who could get home from school the fastest. Steve lives further away than Tim, so he is allowed to ride his bike. Steve lives 3 miles from school and rides his bicycle at a speed of 440 feet per minute. Tim lives 2 miles from school. If Tim can ride a skateboard at 264 feet per minute, how long will the winner wait in his home before the loser finishes?

Shawnda decided the kids in her neighborhood could actually use a bike tire pump service. She decided the best way to charge was by tire. The cost to pump each tire is 25 cents. On the first day, 5 guys came up on two-wheeled bicycles to pump up each tire. 3 people came and inflated the tires of all the three wheeled bikes. Finally, a guy actually came over on a unicycle. How many dollars did she make that day?
Carl bought 10 packages of cookies. There are 6 cookies in each cookie package. Each cookie is $0.10. If Carl pays with a $10 bill, how much change will he receive?

Dave bought a large bag of French fries and ate 14 of them before a hungry seagull stole the bag of chips from his hand. When the seagull landed, it devoured half the number of French fries that Dave had eaten. Then 3 pigeons chased it away from the food and each pigeon ate 3 chips. Later, a raccoon stole two-thirds of the remaining chips. The ant carried away the last French fries, leaving five. When Dave buys this bag of French fries, how many French fries are in it?

Kimo, a college student, has three one-hour classes a day on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays. He has 2 2 hour classes a day on Tuesday and Thursday. There are 16 weeks of schooling in a term. How much time does Kimo spend in class during a semester?

Bill makes 300 rolls, 120 chocolate croissants and 60 baguettes every day. Each roll is 4 inches long, each croissant is 6 inches long, and each baguette is 2 feet long. If Bill laid all the finished loaves end to end, how many feet would they be?

The zookeeper feeds all the apes in the zoo. He orders all his bananas from a local farm every 2 months. If the monkey needs 200 bananas per month, the gorilla needs 400 bananas per month, and the baboon needs 100 bananas per month, how many bananas does he need to order to last him 2 months?

Blake and Kelly were in a race to see who could run the farthest in 15 minutes. They decided to play the game on a football field that was 100 yards long. Blake ran back and forth 15 times. Kelly ran back and forth once and then decided she didn't want to run next to Blake, so she started running to the 40-yard line and back. She did this 34 times. How much farther did the winner run than the loser?
Raphael went to buy some school supplies. He bought 4 pens ($1.50 each), 2 notebooks ($4 each), and a ream of coated paper ($20). How much did Rafael spend on all the supplies?

Finn watched as 11 tadpoles swam around in the pond. Suddenly, he saw 6 of them swimming out from under the lily pads where they were hiding, and then he saw 2 of them hiding under a rock. How many tadpoles can Finn see in the pond now?

One tank had 17 feet of water on Monday. On Tuesday, the water in the tank was an additional 7 feet deep. On Wednesday, the water was two-thirds the depth of Tuesday's water. How deep was the water in the tank on Wednesday?

Anakin and Loxine went to the beach today. Anakin caught 10 starfish, 6 seahorses, and 3 clownfish, while Roxin caught 5 less starfish, 2 seahorses, and 2 more clownfish than Anakin. How many fish did they catch?
If a bag of marble costs $20 and the price goes up 20% from the original price every two months. How much will a bag of marbles cost in 36 months?
In a room there are various toys: 5 red toy cars, 3 toy people, and a doll. The dolls cost the equivalent of 3 toy people and 1 toy car for $4. If a toy man costs $5, how much are all the toys worth?

Jackie is trying to decide whether to handle her taxes herself or hire an accountant. If she handled her own taxes, she would have three fewer hours of freelancing work, resulting in a missed income of $35 per hour. The accounting fee is $90. How much more money will she receive if she hires an accountant?

For her 30th birthday, Elvira chose a computer with many accessories as a gift. She had a budget of €1,500 donated by her family and thought she would be able to save a little money to buy clothes. She went to a computer store and selected a $1,090 computer that included a screen, keyboard, and mouse. She also bought a scanner for €157, a CD burner for €74 and a printer for €102. How much money does she have left to buy clothes?

Every time Sandra babysat for her neighbor's daughter, her neighbor would give her a basket of nine eggs. To make Spanish flan, she needs 3 eggs. How many times would Sandra have to babysit if she was tasked with making 15 Spanish flan for her school's fundraiser?
Seth is twice Brooke's age. After two years, their combined ages will be 28 years. How old is Seth?
Jimmy's money is $2 more than twice Ethel's. If Ethel has $8, how much money does Jimmy have now?
Pancho walks 20 miles every day. Except for weekends, when he walks 10 miles. How many miles does he walk in a week?

The marching band is ordering new uniforms. Each uniform consists of a hat, coat, and trousers, and each hat costs $25, each coat costs three times as much as the hat, and each pair of trousers costs the average price of a hat and coat. How much does each uniform cost?
Jack is visiting the Insect Museum. He saw 80 spiders (each with 8 legs), 90 insects (each with 6 legs), and 3 rare mutant invertebrates (each with 10 legs). How many legs did Jack see in total?

There are 4 birds on the caboose. Sally Two is 3 years older than Grandma Red. Grandma Red is twice as old as Sally Four. If Sally Four is the same age as Sally Thirty-Two, and Sally Thirty-Two is 8 years old, how old are the 4 birds in total?

Jessica is trying to figure out how much she needs to pay off all her debt each month. The minimum monthly payment on her student loan is $300, the minimum monthly payment on her credit card is $200, and the minimum monthly payment on her mortgage is $500. If Jessica wants to pay 50% more than the minimum payment, how much will she pay in a year?

Billy is peeling and dicing potatoes to make potato salad for his big family reunion barbecue. It was a big event, so he had to finish 60 potatoes. Potatoes are all about the same size, and it takes about the same amount of time to peel and dice each potato. It takes Billy about a minute and a half to peel a potato, but only about 5 seconds to dice a potato. How long does it take Billy to prepare these potatoes?

Juan and his brother Carlos are selling lemonade. For every gallon of lemonade they make, they use $3 of lemons and $2 of sugar. They make 20 cups per gallon and sell them for $0.50 each. If their profit was $25, how much did they spend on lemons?
In a game of 240 Asians, 80 were Japanese and the rest were Chinese. If the Chinese team has 60 male players, how many female players are there in the Chinese team?

Zaid spends a quarter of his salary on rent, a third of his salary on gas, and donates half of the remaining salary to his favorite charity. He gives his daughter $200 for weekly expenses and his wife $700 to budget for groceries and other household items. If Zaid makes $6,000 a month, how much money will he have left after paying all these fees and donations?
Lani has 10 more crabs than Monique. Monique has 4 crabs less than Bo. If the wave has 40 crabs, count the total number of crabs that three people have.
Lloyd makes $10 an hour as a math tutor. He tutored for 5 hours in the first week and 8 hours in the second week. How much did he earn in the first two weeks?

At Sarai's school, two candidates are running for class representative. If the winner received 3/4 of the votes and the total number of students voting in the class is 80, count the votes received by the losers.

Sandra, the owner of a corner flower shop, was unhappy with Fred's failure to fulfill her order. Sandra ordered 4 times as many red roses as white carnations. She also ordered 200 pink calla lilies, five times the number of white carnations. Sandra threatened to change suppliers if the missing red roses were not delivered by 5 p.m. How many red roses must Fred deliver by 5 p.m. in order to retain Sandra's business?
Jane is 2 years older than Mark. Two years ago, Mark was five years older than half Jean's age. If she were 30 years old now, how old would Jane be now?

Two track and field teams compete in a 4 by 400 meter relay. In this race, each team has four members and each member runs 400 meters or one lap around a standard track. Of the two teams, one was very neat, with each member running the 400m leg in exactly 55 seconds. The other team was less organized, with the first runner finishing the 400m in 60 seconds, and then each runner finishing 3 seconds faster than the previous runner. Based on this information, how many seconds more did the faster team win?
Jerry is rolling a six-sided die. How much more likely (expressed as a percentage) is his chance of rolling a number greater than 3 than of two even numbers in a row?
Jenna and her mother picked some apples from their apple orchard. Jenna picked half as many apples as her mother. If her mother picked 20 apples, how many apples did the two of them pick?

Russell works in a pet store and is distributing straw to rodents. Rats were housed in 3 cages with the same number in each group, and each rat was assigned 6 straws. Hamsters were housed individually in 10 cages, and each hamster was given 5 straws. There was also a cage of rabbits who were given 20 straws. Straw is not used anywhere else in the pet store. If 160 straws are given to small rodents, how many rats are in each cage?
Mandy owes Benedict $100. They agreed on a monthly interest rate of 2%. If Mandy can pay off her debt in 3 months, how much will she have to pay Benedict?

A businessman bought several bags of wheat from a farmer for $20 per bag. If it costs $2 to transport each bag of wheat from the farm to the warehouse, and the merchant makes a total profit of $400 after selling all the wheat at $30 per bag, how many bags does he sell?

Three friends spent $20.25 on 3 amusement park tickets. They also spent $4.50 less than the cost of those tickets on food. They also went on 2 different rides for $33 each. If they agree to split all costs equally, how much will each of them pay?
John picked peaches for 3 hours. He can pick 2 peaches in a minute. How many peaches did he pick?
Ducks need to eat 3.5 pounds of insects per week to survive. If there were a flock of 10 ducks, how many pounds of insects would they need per day?
Tom plants 10 trees every year. He also cuts down 2 trees per year. He started with 50 trees. After 10 years, 30% of the trees died. How many trees does he have left?

Sue lives in an interesting neighborhood. One weekend, the neighbors decided to play a prank on Sue. On Friday morning, neighbors placed 18 pink plastic flamingos in Sue's front yard. On Saturday morning, neighbors took back a third of the flamingos, painted them white, and returned the freshly painted white flamingos back to Sue's front yard. Then, on Sunday morning, they added 18 more pink plastic flamingos to the flock. How many more pink plastic flamingos are there than white plastic flamingos at noon on Sunday?
Violetta wants to buy new crayons. She needs 5 different colors of crayons and has $20 for the purchase. $2 for a crayon. How much change will she receive?
The price of a pen is the total price of a pencil and an eraser. A pencil is $1.20 and an eraser is $0.30. How much do 8 pens cost?
200 pounds of carrots are to be distributed among 40 restaurants in a certain city. Each restaurant will receive 2 pounds of carrots. How many pounds of carrots will not be used?

In the municipality of Soda, the exact number of inhabitants is 23,786. They included 8,417 men and 9,092 women. The rest of the population consists of children. How many children are there in Soda City?

Elaine originally had 20 Pokémon cards. A month later, she had collected three times that amount. In the second month, she collected 20 fewer cards than she collected in the first month. In the third month, she collected twice as many Pokémon cards as she collected in the first and second months combined. How many Pokémon cards does she have now?

Mark is a copy editor. He edited the same number of sentences each week for two different publishers, who each paid him a different price per sentence. Publisher B pays Mark twice as much as Publisher A pays. Mark edits a total of 1,000 sentences per week, and Publisher A pays him 5 cents per sentence. How many cents does Mark earn per week?

Baldr fetched water from the well. He fetched 5 buckets of water every morning and 6 buckets of water every afternoon. If there are 5 liters of water in each bucket, how many liters of water does he get per day?

John won an award for his work. This award includes a 1x cash award of $5,000 and a 5% salary increase. If he earns 2,000 per week (every week of the year) and he wins the award on the first day of the year, how much does he earn during the year?
Josie grows grapes on her 10-acre farm. Each acre produces 5 tons of grapes per year, and each ton of grapes produces 2 barrels of wine. How many barrels of wine does her farm produce each year?

Carl's favorite food is cheese. He's been eating sandwiches for lunch every day this week, with 2 slices of cheese per sandwich. He eats cheese and an omelet for breakfast 3 days this week, using 1 more slice of cheese per omelet than per sandwich. He made a large portion of mac and cheese for several dinners this week and put 8 slices of cheese in it. How many slices of cheese did he use?

Janet has 22 green pens and 10 yellow pens. Then she bought 6 packs of blue pens and 2 packs of red pens. There are 9 pens in each blue pen pack and 6 pens in each red pen pack. How many pens does Janet have now?

Brinley is a student in Mr. Burt's math class. Mr. Burt gives 6 exams each term. He allowed students to drop their lowest grade from each semester's average. If Brinley scored 89, 71, 92, 100, and 86 on the first five exams, what score would he need on the sixth exam to reach an average score of 93?

Michael likes to ride his bicycle. He rides at least five times a week, covering 25 kilometers each time. He rode like this for 4 weeks and then he decided to ride his bike only 2 times a week but for 60km each time and he did this for 3 weeks. How many kilometers did Michael ride in total?

Joe's Halloween candy bag contains 25 chocolate bars and 80 candied apples. Each chocolate bar weighs twice as much as each candied apple. If each chocolate bar weighs 40 grams, how many grams does Joe's candy bag weigh?

Ruth went to the shop on Monday and bought 4 cakes. On Tuesday she went to a different store and bought three times the amount of cakes. On Wednesday she went to another store and bought five times the amount of cakes she bought on Tuesday. How many cakes did she buy in three days?
The total cost of twenty dozen cups is $1,200 less than the total cost of half a dozen plates, which sell for $6,000 each. Calculate the total cost of purchasing each cup.

Sarah wants to buy herself a new jacket and 2 pairs of shoes. The jacket she wants costs $30 and each pair of shoes costs $20. Sarah babysat her neighbor's children 4 times, earning $5 each time she babysat them. Her parents pay her $4 every time she mows the lawn. If Sarah had saved $10 before starting babysitting, how many times would she have to mow the lawn before she could afford a jacket and shoes?

Jerry has a flock of chickens. Red chickens lay 3 eggs per day and white chickens lay 5 eggs per day. Jerry collects 42 eggs every day. If he has two more white chickens than red chickens, how many red chickens does he have?
Gary enjoys walking along the edge of his local park, a 1.5 mile by 6 mile rectangular park. If he walked at 3 mph, how many hours did he spend walking?

At the dollar store, Sloan counted 100 customers entering the store. The next day, she counted 50 more people in the store than on the first day. If the total number of customers by the third day is 500, how many customers came to the store on the third day?

Jerry has two pools, both with gaps, and both drain at 4 gpm. 4 minutes ago, the large pool had twice as much water as the small pool. The large pool now holds four times as much water as the small pool. How much water is in the small pool now?
Lori wants to buy a pair of shoes that cost $320.00 and a matching belt that costs $32.00. She earns $8.00 an hour at her part-time job. How many hours does she have to work to make the purchase?
Janice borrows $2,000 and promises to return an additional 10% of that amount. If she plans to pay $165 per month for 12 months, what is Janice's remaining balance due at that time?
There are 4 roses in the vase. There are 7 more dahlias than roses in the vase. How many flowers are there in the vase?
Adrian is three times Harriet's age, and Harriet is half Zach's age. If Harriet is 21 years old now, calculate the average age of these three people three years from now.

Four students scored a combined 251 points in a board game. Naomi scored 68 points. Yuri scored 10 more points than half Naomi, and Brianna scored 17 more points than Naomi. How many points did Jojo score?

It takes Carmen 10 minutes to complete a crossword puzzle and 5 minutes to complete a Sudoku puzzle. She completed 3 crossword puzzles and 8 Sudoku puzzles over the weekend. How much time does she spend playing these games?

A tank holds 120 liters of water. Celine watered her small garden with 90 liters of water from a tank. She later collected twice as much rainwater as the remaining water. How many liters of water are in the tank now?
Andy planted 90 geraniums and 40 fewer petunias than geraniums. How many flowers did he plant in total?
A company spends $15,000 on advertising one year and one-third of that amount on advertising another year. What is the total amount of money this company spent on advertising in the past two years?

Carlos and Benji are on the beach. Carlos rented a canoe for $30 an hour and Benji rented a banana raft for $18 an hour. If Carlos uses the boat for 3 hours and Benji uses the raft for 5 hours, how much rent will they pay in total?

Andrew plans a road trip from New Jersey to Rochester. It takes six days to travel from New Jersey to Rochester by bus and half as many days by car. If he plans to take the bus to Rochester and then drive back from Rochester, how many days will he travel?

James is counting his Pokémon cards. He has 30 fire cards, 20 grass cards, and 40 water cards. If he loses 8 water cards and buys 14 grass cards, what is the chance that a randomly selected card is water (rounded to the nearest whole number)?

Chad ordered a homemade burrito for lunch. The basic burrito is $6.50. He added extra meat for $2.00, cheese for $1.00, avocado for $1.00, and 2 sauces for $0.25 each. He decided to spend an extra $3.00 to upgrade his meal, adding chips and a drink. He has a $5.00 gift card to use at checkout. How much more does he have to pay?

Kelinda is working on a 360-piece puzzle with her mother. Kelinda can put together 4 pieces per minute under normal circumstances. Her mother can usually put together half as many pieces per minute as Kelinda. How many hours will it take them to put the puzzle together?

One watermelon farm produced 120 small watermelons. Ashlyn visited the farm two months later and found 30 percent of the watermelons were ready to pick, so she took them home. When she came back two weeks later, 3/4 of the remaining melons were ripe, so she picked them all. How many melons are still unripe after these two weeks?

Mark bought a fleet of 12 vehicles for his company. Each vehicle sells for $20,000. He paid 10 percent tax on the cars and a $1,000 registration fee for each vehicle. How much did he spend on all this?

Kelly and Robert love to go to the beach and collect seashells. On Monday, Kelly collected 5 more shells than Robert, who collected 20 shells. On Tuesday, Kelly collected 2 times more shells than she collected on Monday. How many shells did Kelly collect on Tuesday?
Dax goes to their farm to pick apples and discovers that there are half as many bugs as ants in the garden. If there are 50 ants, count the total number of insects in the garden.
There were 36 penguins sunbathing in the snow. A third of them jumped into the sea and swam. Another third enter the cave to feed. How many penguins are still basking in the sun?

Steve decided to start eating more tomatoes and decided to grow his own cherry tomatoes. He eats twice as much as his girlfriend. He eats 6 a day. If one vine can produce 3 tomatoes per week, how many vines will he need?

John ordered some pizza to share with his friends. There were 20 friends in total, and John wanted to make sure everyone got 4 pieces. Pizza is only sold in 8 pieces. How much pizza does John need to order?

Ram uses a lot of pens. He discovered that he could save money by mixing the ink from five empty pens to make one full pen. If he buys 25 pens and then uses them to make new pens when the ink is almost empty, how many full pens will he get?
Johnny took $20 in pocket money and added $10 to that. He then invested the money and tripled it within a year. How much money will he have after one year?
Mary is two years younger than Joan, who is five years older than Jessa. If Jessa is 20 years old, what is the combined age of the three girls?

The number of students in a school hall is 1,000. The auditorium has 3 entrances A, B and C which also serve as exits. If after a meeting, 30% of the students left through exit A, 3/5 of the remaining students went out through exit B, and the remainder went out through exit C, count the number of students who left through exit C.
James has 6 more candies than Robert. John has twice as much candy as Robert. If John has 54 candies, how many more candies does John have than James?
Dolly has two books. Pandora has one. If Dolly and Pandora both read each other's books and their own books, how many books will they have read in total by the end?

Mike has been a pen pal to 5 people. He and 2 of them are no longer pen pals. They each send 2 5-page letters per week. He responded in kind. He can write a page every 6 minutes. How many hours a week does he spend writing letters?

Jason has a 1,000-minute monthly cell phone plan. He's on the phone with his boss for 15 minutes every day, and this month he's already spent an extra 300 minutes on the phone with other people. If the month has 30 days, how many minutes does Jason have left?

Griffin had 24 chips, but Kyle took 5 of them. Billy got twice as much as Kyle. Ginger gave Griffin a handful of her chips, then Colby took 3 fewer chips from Griffin than Kyle took. If Griffin ended up with 27 fries, how many fries did Ginger give Griffin?

There are 4 snails in one aquarium and 32 snails in another aquarium. The difference in the number of snails in the two aquariums is twice the number of fish in the two aquariums. If the number of fish in two aquariums is the same, how many fish are in each aquarium?

Jen's makeup artist charges $250 an hour. One of the movies she was in required very expensive makeup, which required her to put on makeup for six hours a day, four times a week. The film took 5 weeks to shoot. After the movie was done, the makeup artist gave Jen a 10% discount because it was a lot of work. How much did Jane pay?

Isabelle bought party supplies for her sister's birthday party. She spent $12 on ingredients for the cake, $43 on birthday gifts, $15 on decorations, $4 on invitations and $22 on gift bags for party guests. She and her three parents split the expenses equally. How many dollars did each person pay?
A chef buys 4 bags of onions. Each bag weighs 50 pounds. A pound of onions costs $1.50. How much did the chef spend?

On Monday, Sue ate 4 times as many cookies as her sister. On Tuesday, she ate twice as many cookies as her sister. Her sister ate 5 cookies on Monday and 13 the next day. If 1 cookie contains 200 calories, how many more calories does Sue eat than her sister?
